subject: Climate & Environment
title: Mold and Moisture
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mold and Moisture usable.

hook.text: Mold spores are everywhere. All they need is moisture and a surface to colonize.

buildup.text: Leaky pipes, poor ventilation, and condensation create the damp conditions mold loves.

discovery.text: Mold exposure triggers allergic reactions, asthma attacks, and chronic respiratory symptoms.

twist.text: Black mold produces mycotoxins that can cause neurological symptoms in severe cases.

climax.text: Keeping indoor humidity below 50% is the simplest way to prevent mold from taking hold.

punchline.text: Mold doesn't need an invitation. Just a little water and time.

quiz.question: What indoor humidity level helps prevent mold growth?
